definitions.definition: To take (a child, heir, friend, citizen, etc.) by choice into a relationship .

subdefinitions.definition: To take voluntarily (a child of other parents) to be in the place of, or as, one's own child.
examples: A friend of mine recently adopted a Chinese baby girl found on the streets of Beijing.

subdefinitions.definition: To obtain (a pet) from a shelter or the wild.
examples: We're going to adopt a Dalmatian.

subdefinitions.definition: To contribute towards the upkeep of (a child or animal), in exchange for occasional stories, pictures, etc.
examples: We adopted an elephant at the local zoo.

subdefinitions.definition: To take by choice into the scope of one's responsibility.
examples: This supermarket chain adopts several families every Yuletide, providing them with money and groceries for the holidays.

definitions.definition: To take or receive as one's own what is not so naturally.
examples: He adopted a new look in order to fit in with his new workmates.

definitions.definition: To select and take or approve.
examples: to adopt the view or policy of another
These are resolutions that were adopted .

definitions.definition: To beat an opponent ten times in a row.
examples: The match was not even close; the IM made amateurish blunders and ended up getting adopted .

main_definition: To take (a child, heir, friend, citizen, etc.) by choice into a relationship .
secondary_definitions: To take or receive as one's own what is not so naturally.
To select and take or approve.
( chess , slang ) To beat an opponent ten times in a row.
